name: Aarav Nair
warning_signs: Severe swelling in legs, ankles, or face
Decreased urine output or dark-colored urine
follow_up_instructions: Attend dialysis sessions as scheduled (3 times per week)
Monitor blood pressure daily and log readings
Limit sodium intake to 2000mg per day
discharge_summary:
Patient Aarav Nair was admitted on 2025-09-05 with Urinary Tract Infection with Complications. 
During hospitalization, patient was managed with Insulin glargine 20 units at bedtime, Atorvastatin 20mg at bedtime, Amlodipine 5mg daily. 
Procedures performed included Peritoneal dialysis catheter insertion, Kidney biopsy.
Patient's condition improved and was stable at discharge. 
Discharged home with instructions to follow up with nephrologist and continue medications as prescribed. 
Patient educated on warning signs and dietary restrictions.
